intro: Philibertia incana, commonly known as the silverleaf filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs, and its delicate white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance. Philibertia incana is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
